main_definition: To depend or trust upon someone or something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have confidence in the ability, qualities, or strength of a person or thing. For example, 'I rely on my best friend to give me honest advice.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'She relies on her husband for emotional support during tough times.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: To use something as a means of support or help. For example, 'I have to rely on my notes when I can't remember the information from memory.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'During a power outage, we had to rely on candles for lighting.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: To depend on or trust in someone or something. For example, 'As a child, I relied heavily on my parents' guidance and advice.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'After losing his job, he had to rely on unemployment benefits while searching for new employment.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: To count on or expect something as certain. For example, 'I rely that you will be at the party tonight.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'We can rely on the sun to rise every morning.'
